body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Directions & Transportation     Maps              Maps         Local Area MapDownloadable PDF version of our Local Area Map (legal-size page, 8½" x 14"; file size: 1.2 Mb)      Park Map & Brochure  Downloadable PDF version of our Official Park Map & Brochure. (letter-size page, 865 kb)       Wilkinson Trail Map & Brochure Downloadable PDF version of our Wilkinson (hiking) Trail Map & Brochure. (legal-size, 2-page, 670 kb)      Additional Park Brochures         Neilson House Brochure  John Neilson Farmhouse, only standing structure on Saratoga Battlefield from the time of the Battles of Saratoga. (PDF document, 1 MB)         Philip Schuyler House Schuyler House, the country estate of American General Philip Schuyler, "one of the most important Americans you've never heard of." (PDF document, 305 kb)         Saratoga Monument Saratoga Monument, a 155-foot obelisk built in the late 19th century to commemorate the American victory in the Battles of Saratoga. (PDF document, 365 kb)         Victory Woods Victory Woods is a 22-acre area that marked the final encampment site for the British army that fought in the Battles of Saratoga prior to their surrender on October 17, 1777.  (PDF document, 2.5 MB)
title: Saratoga National Historical Park: Maps
